bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: On October 9 in 1888 the United Hebrew Trades organization was born to serve as a catalyst that would nurture the growth of the new new-born labor movement. Among its leading members were Bernard Weinstein, Morris Hilquit and Abe Cahan of "the Jewish Daily Forward". The Hebrew Actors' Union was among the unions represented at the first meeting. The union membership of the United Hebrew Trades at the time of its formation numbered a grand total of 70. Undaunted, the organization began its work. Their message to every-day bread and butter concerns of the ordinary worker. They built from the bottom up, not from the top down. Mass propaganda was one of their effective weapons. Among their 'revolutionary' departures was to talk to the Jewish worker in his own language.
